Description: Shoulder sherd of Aiolian pottery dinos; interior streakily glazed; exterior, cream slip: band of hook maeander above tongue frieze.
Producer name: Attributed to: The London Dinos Group
Curator's comments: The sherd belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1924,1201.1026 and 1027. A very similar piece was analysed by Hans Mommsen (Bonn) with NAA and found to belong to chemical group g, attributed to an Aiolian provenance: see Kerschner 2006, p. 124, fig. 15. Kerschner, M. 2006, 'On the provenance of Aiolian pottery, 'n Villing, A. and Schlotzhauer, U. (eds) 2006, Naukratis: Greek Diversity in Egypt. Studies on Greek Pottery and Exchange in the Eastern Mediterranean (British Museum Research Publication 162), London, 109–126.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 253, no. 401) (Lemos incorrectly identifies this sherd as Chian)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GK.08)
